intro: Strobilanthes dielsiana, commonly known as the "ghost flower," is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is notable for its unique inflorescence, which consists of dense clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is also recognized for its short blooming period, which occurs during the monsoon season. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species in its native range.
